title: Rotational kinematics - disks A and B relate alpha

content.question: Two disks, Disk <math alttext="A " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and Disk <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, are initially at rest and begin to spin with a constant angular acceleration. Disk <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has an angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and completes one full rotation in a time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>. Disk <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has an angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> and completes two full rotations in a time <math alttext="2 delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly relates the angular accelerations of the two disks?

choices.label: <math alttext="alpha sub B equals one half alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="alpha sub B equals the fraction 1 over the square root of 2, end fraction, alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="alpha sub B equals alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="alpha sub B equals 2 alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="alpha sub B equals one half alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
